instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 rMBP SSD not mounting anymore
threads.message:
This macbook had a bad keyboard but was booting and working fine. I removed the SSD to plug it into an OWC Envoy enclousure to make sure the data was fine and after I was done I simply unplugged the usb to the envoy instead of safely ejecting so I'm not sure if that caused this problem but now when I boot the ssd it stops around halfway and the screen goes black and shuts down.

Now when I check the disk utility with the SSD in the enclosure or in the Macbook the SSD won't mount even when I click the mount button in disk utility. I even tried to manually mount using command lines in the terminal but it would not mount.
I tried doing the first aid but it would fail and say to back up data if possible.

I'm not sure what else I could do to mount the drive. I attached images of the disk utility screen.

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 rMBP SSD not mounting anymore
threads.message:
Leave it for an hour and see if it will mount. It will give you a warning that it can't restore the volume but you can get at the data.

NEVER unplug a volume without unmounting it, this is what happens....

You can also use diskwarrior to fix the volume if it mounts after a while, Disk Utility is useless for this.

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 rMBP SSD not mounting anymore
threads.message:
Okay I won't do that again but your right it showed me the message telling me I can copy the data off of it.

Thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]2015 rMBP SSD not mounting anymore
threads.message: Get diskwarrior it will fix the directory once it has mounted.
